result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph W. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Pierce County 15CT78

miscConds.notes:
DNA Sample and Surcharge
Comply with all requirements of the Pierce County Drug program and successfully complete it. 
No possession or consumption of alcohol or drugs. 
No entry into bars or taverns without the permission of the probation agent. 
Comply with any counseling and treatment requirements as set by probation agent.

records.addlTxt: For Order For Return of Property Seized.  Submitted by Aaron A. Nelson.

2:00  This includes 15CT78, 15TR645, 646, 647, 648  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Rory OSullivan  appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties stipulate that Exh # 8 which is the defendant's wallet with his driver license inside of it can be returned to the defendant. Exh # 4 is a photo of the wallet and Exh #5 is a photo of the driver license.  OSullivan - S/W Probation on all cts  4 yrs probation. 6 months cond jail time on the OAR.    $389.50 $175.30  $ 213.10 forf amounts.  Fleeing has 6 month revocation                        Court orders -  15CF138 S/W Probation 3 yrs            15CT78    OAR and IID  S/W Probation  2 years on each Ct.    Probation on all counts all cases conc to each other.    Cond of all probations is to  Comply with all requirements of th PC Drug program and successfully complete it.   No Possession or consumption of alcohol or drugs.   No entry into bars or taverns w/o permission of probation agent.     Seek and Maintain full time employment.   On 15CF138  DNA Sample,   Costs plus DNA SC.     Court  Waives the costs on the 2 misd chgs in 15CT78.  Forf amounts are assessed on the  all of the TR cases as stated on the citations.     Time to pay is $50 per mo on the TR Case totals  beg Dec 1.   Costs over the course of probation on the criminal chgs.   Comply with counseling and treatment requirements as set by probation agent.         15CF138   Fleeing - 6 month revocation.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant.

#8-evidence envelope containing wallet and letter addressed to Joe Hayes (not scanned)
10-27-2015 stipulation and agreement to wallet being returned to Def.
#7-certified copy of Joe Hayes' driving record.
#6-photo of letter addressed to Joe Hayes

9:17  This includes 15CT78,  15TR645,  15TR646, 15TR647, 15TR648, Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge reviews the defendant's right to a jury trial with him. Defendant waives his right to a jury trial and wants to go ahead with a trial to the court. Thorie gives opening statement. Aaron Nelson gives opening stmt.   Attorneys request the witnesses be sequestered.  Officer Chad Koranda is sw and ex by Thorie. Witness Id's the defendant. Nelson x-exams. Deputy Allen Wojcyk is sworn and exam by Thorie. Exh 9  large map of area. Exh 1 Photo driver door open,  Exh 2 Photo Wheel well - tire shredded,  Exh 3 Photo of license plate Exh 1,2,3 offered and received.  Exh 4 Photo of wallet in counsel of car, Exh 5 Photo Driver license in wallet,  Exh 6 Photo of letter addressed to Joe Hayes  Exh 8 Envelope with wallet and driver license in it. Exh 4,5,6 8 are offered and received. Exh 10 Lg drawing by A Nelson offered and received for demonstrative purposes.  Exh 7 Cert copy of Joe hayes driving record. Offered and rec. Mitch Rhiel is sw and ex by Thorie A Nelson x-exams .   10:52  Break 10 minute.  11:02  Court resumes, attorneys, defendant present. A Nelson X-exams Mitch Rhiel. Thorie re-directs. A Nelson re-x-exams  Exh 9 is offered and received by demonstrative purposes.  State Rests.  11:07   Richard Hayes is sw and ex by A Nelson. Judge reviews the witnesses 5th amendmt right with him. Exh 11  Chart drawn by A Nelson offered and rec. Thorie x-exams. Nelson re- directs.   Ryan Field is sw and ex by A Nelson. Thorie x-exams.  Judge reviews the right to testify with the defendant. Defendant waives his right to testify. Court accepts the waiver.  Thorie recalls Deputy Wojcyk.  Nelson objects due to the sequestration order.  Court allows testimony.  Nelson x-exams. Defense rests.  Thorie gives arguement. Nelson gives arguement.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the charges and on the forfeitures. Court finds the burden of proof has been net by the state. Thorie  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

9:36 Includes 15CT78 and 15TR645-648 Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared via phone.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def agrees to have this hearing via phone. Atty Nelson addresses the Def to this agreement. Court: Constitutional rights explained to defendant of waiving a jury trial.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def waives his right to have a jury trial and requests a court trial.Court grants and accepts waiver and will consent to hold a court trial. Court trial will be held at 9:00 on Oct 22, 2015.
(copy of given by the DA's office) From Atty Nelson to Judge Duvall re: defendant waives his right to a jury trial and requests a court trial, attached waiver of jury trial.
from Atty Thorie re: consents to a waiver of jury trial and agrees to a trial by the Court pending approval of the court.

10:32 Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CT78 and 15TR645,646,647,648 heard at this time. THorie moves the court to join all cases to be heard on the same jury trial date. Atty Nelson has no objection. Court grants motion and all cases will be heard on Oct 22. Court any final offers with in the next 10 days. Nelson brings up a waiver of a jury. Court: doesn't have a problem with it. Thorie responds.  Court; disclosure of witnesses need to be exchanged.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing held on June 27, 2015 with Court Commissioner Gavic presiding. Filed by RMR Carlson

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 4:25 Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15TR645-648 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaint.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Nelson pleas not guilty on 15CT78 and 15TR645-648. Reminds the court he filed a substitution of Judge on all these cases. Court rec's and enters not guilty plea. Bond to continue.
of Judge signed by Def and Atty Nelson

4:23 Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron A. Nelson.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson gives a substitution of Judge on all files heard today and will proceed today on the arraignment. Def waives reading. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec's and enters.

8:33  15CT78, 15TR645,646,647,648, are following with this case.   Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court with attorney Aaron Alan Nelson.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nelson moves to sequestor witnesses. Court so orders.   Deputy Alan Wojcik is sw and ex by Thorie.  Nelson x-exams. Deputy Rhiel is sw and exam by Wm Thorie. Witness id's the defendant. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for further proceedings. Thorie files the information. A Nelson requests to have the arraignment to be set at t differend time. The other cases listed will be following along with this one.  Arraignment scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

3:56 Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Joseph W. Hayes in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared via phone as well.15CT78 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads counts and charges on both files.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $500 cash bond on 15CF138. Larimore: requests signature bond. Thorie and Larimore requests plea on 15CT78 be taken at arraignment. Thorie: $1000 sign on 15CT78.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
